bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Health Professions Act;
chiropractic means the health profession in which a person provides, for the purposes of promotion, maintenance and restoration of health, the services of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: assessment of the spine or other joints of the body and the associated tissue, and the nervous system,

treatment of nervous system, muscular and skeletal diseases, disorders and conditions through manipulation or adjustment of the spine or other joints of the body by hand or by using devices directly related to the manipulation or adjustment, and
advice and counseling on matters related to the condition of the spine or other joints of the body and the associated tissue, the nervous system and the overall health of the individual;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: college means the College of Chiropractors of British Columbia continued under section 15.1 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The titles "chiropractor" and "doctor" are reserved for exclusive use by registrants.
This section does not prohibit a person from using

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the title "doctor" in a manner authorized by another enactment that regulates a health profession, or
an academic or educational designation that the person is entitled to use.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A registrant in the course of practising chiropractic may do any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: make a diagnosis identifying, as the cause of signs or symptoms of an individual, a disease, disorder or condition of the spine or other joints of the body and the associated tissue, and the nervous system;
move a joint of the spine beyond the limits the body can voluntarily achieve but within the anatomical range of motion using a high velocity, low amplitude thrust;
put an instrument, a device or a finger into the external ear canal for the purpose of assessing the ear and auditory systems;
put a finger beyond the anal verge for the purpose of manipulating the coccyx;
apply X-rays for diagnostic or imaging purposes, excluding X-rays for the purpose of computerized axial tomography;
issue an instruction or authorization for another person to apply, to a named individual,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: electromagnetism for the purpose of magnetic resonance imaging, or
X-rays for diagnostic or imaging purposes, including X-rays for the purpose of computerized axial tomography.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Only a registrant may provide a service of chiropractic as set out in this regulation if, on the day before this section comes into force, the provision of the same service by anyone other than a person authorized under the Chiropractors Act was prohibited.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The college is designated for the purposes of section 16 (2) (f) of the Act.
Part 4 of the Act applies to chiropractic.
